newsitem.title: USA: Power Spectra wins $1.2 million contract.
newsitem.headline: Power Spectra wins $1.2 million contract.

text.p: Power Spectra Inc on Tuesday said it has received a $1.2 million, first phase contract to develop a ground penetrating radar system for detecting precious metals and minerals underground.
Under the deal, Power Spectra will develop and deliver an operational sensor assembly which would lead to a complete portable system for targeting gold deposits behind mine walls.

"This project, which we expect to complete before year end, may foreshadow the first broad scale use of GPR in the precious metals mining industry," Gordon Smith, chief executive, said in a statement.
The contract was awarded to Power Spectra by San Francisco Bay Area-based LandRay Technology Inc.
